comments.body: I agree, it would be cool to see something like this
I second this, but maybe not a light level of 14 like an actual torch, maybe more like 7 or 8, or whatever the glow berries light level is
Please make this a feature Minecraft.
We need deny, allow and border block to java

I agree with this because I'm making a minigame server on Java and since I've never made a Java server before, I dont really know how to make certain blocks unbreakable. But if they added Deny, Allow, and Border blocks then it would make my job a lot easier.
yes because they are awesome
True, I was sad when they got rid of them.
why mojang why??!!

:( short lived
I agree definitely
Honestly, this idea is pretty good.
I love this idea; it would be so useful.
Maybe not FULLY invisible so you can still see the item frame, maybe the backdrop is invisible but the birch outline is still visible.

I don't think this should just be a java feature, but yeah using phantom membranes to make an invisible/transparent item frame could be cool. Another possible way they could implement it would be to have you right click on an item frame (that's holding an item) with a phantom membrane and the item frame will disappear. This would make it so when the item is removed, the item frame could register as empty and thus would reappear.
This isn't really needed... and many people have suggested this same idea before.
yea i know, its just something that they could add in if they wanted to, it adds the feeling of achieving one of the hardest ores to get in a normal survival world with keep inventory off.
How do you get better than netherite it literally gives you max armor points and I think it also gives you knock back resistance or something like that
Ye but full diamond gives full armor points too bro!
it doesnt have to be armor, it could be the strongest horse armor or something
I want a new ore I am voting this
They should do this for crafting tables as well.
...and bookshelves.
Dont forget sticks

408635279832

You probably shouldn't insult them on their own website... or at all really. It's kind of rude (and it's reasonable that they haven't added this yet).

Logs are able to be rotated, so too could stairs. I do understand the technical difficulties involved in implementing this, but I really do think it is worth everyone's while. Perhaps they could have a major update to tackle things like this.
(sad vertical slab noises)
I just posted a suggestion for minecart physics, which is in dire need of an overhaul
Adding multiple furnace minecarts to a long chain would increase the speed
There is also the mangrove rooted mud which can be crafted why can't you craft rooted dirt.
I suggest 2 dirt + 2 hanging roots for 2 rooted dirt. The recipe could be like the coarse dirt

There actually used to be a crafting recipe for saddles I believe, but it was removed when horses were added, which made saddles way more useful. Items like saddles, name tags, and horse armor don't have crafting recipes for good reasons.
I remember when you used to be able to craft saddles. But that was a while back. Like back when Notch owned minecraft!
or 3 leather, 2 chains (or a lead or even string)
Wow, can't believe that isn't in the game already!
it could maybe also mmaybe ignite TNT
This could be kind annoying but also handy in some cases.

Why this might not work as intended: you shoot an arrow at, say, a zombie in front of the wooden wall of a house you just made. It gets set on fire. It burns down. You realize you probably should’ve just used a regular bow.
@AwayMacaroon704  but you see, it already does
A simple solution for not burning down your house, don't shoot flaming arrows around it.

I think it could be the handheld versions that had a big flash bulb and a body that looked like an accordian in a suitcase (look it up). Education Edition already has a camera, but it is something that can be placed on the ground.
Amethyst / Tinted Glass could be used to construct it and/or the film for the camera. Film could just look like blackish paper that can have pictures attached to it like a book and quill.
Eyes of Ender could also be used in its construction as Endermen see inverted colors, a property that is used in developing old photos.
The Cameras flash could light up the area around you, and possibly stun mobs that look at it.
It would also be interesting if cameras had certain effects on mobs, such as some being invisible, making invisible things visible, being able to look at Endermen without angering them, etc.
This may not yet be possible without shaders, but colored photographs could be developed in rooms where only colored light is shown
Perfection.
It's a medieval fantasy game.
you can do the same thing for free by pressing f2
No te entendí ni mergas no sé inglés
PlutonicPoet34, I would disagree. There is redstone, concrete, and TNT which were not invented in medieval times.
Trees should have branch blocks that grow leaves, either with the block changing textures to look like leaves or the block would generate leaf particles that can fall as well
I was about to post almost the same thing, i also think trees should be able to grow back aslong as a stump is left

Great idea! I think that this would also work well with a sword, but perhaps it would be exclusive with mending so that it is not too overpowered. I think that Prosper is the name that fits best, but that's just me. Voted!
Interesting idea.
This seems like a really good idea! I agree with what  HeyBobHen said that it shouldn't work with mending. Really good for mob grinders.
Good idea dood
I also think this is a great idea
I think this is a bit circular as experience is used to put enchantments on. Still, I voted

Hello, I really love your idea, and I would like them to put it in minecraft
 too, I hope they do, it would help me a lot

I love this idea. If they want to make it more rare, possibly exclude this enchant from enchantment tables and only have it as a possibility as a trade from a villager or a find in end cities / other boss towers.

+ vote.
Instead of mending, it should be mutually exclusive with Fortune and Looting. That said, it would be great for 1.19: it'd also make skulk blocks grow larger
I believe a good name for it would be "Magical drain"

The blacksmith should sell them.

Horses would have a new horseshoe slot.
and copper/cut copper trapdoor too ;)

Something to add to this, perhaps you use some existing machine (furnace, stonecutter) or a new one to return copper to its original form? Maybe the green copper is less powerful, so you either have to use it for decorative purposes, or you have to tend to whatever you built with it. (The trade off being copper is very strong)
i really like this idea. copper in contact with water source blocks or water flow blocks should experience accelerated aging. also rain/thunderstorms should accelerate copper aging.
What if copper didn't age as a block, but each face could have an oxidized state? I thought this would be cool if you found Copper Ores. The sides that were exposed to air would be green
I was just thinking about good ways they could add a way to accelerate copper aging and I think this one is great.

Ravagers, as far as we know, weren't captured, they were made. I think it would be cool, but they would have to be very rare, also, I'd have them depicting completely unknown mobs, from long before those who came before the player.
Some colorful hand prints (or square prints) from those who came before would also be nice

I agree. These planks could also be made into doors, fences, trapdoors, fences, buttons, pressure plates and signs like all other wood types. The mushroom stems could also be made into hyphae like nether fungi.
This would be great
That could also be really sweet looking if you had some nice shaders on your playthrough.
Plus its romantic
This would have to be a mod, since moving light sources are not supported without optifine or other dynamic lighting mods. Would be a great mod though.
No emerald, and I would 100% support.
And different sized shields
I love this idea! This idea is epic! You guys should check out mine! It's called Minecraft update ideas, and it has 7 different ideas, you should go check that one out!
how do u propose this would work?
First colored lighting needs to be implemented.
I 100% agree! In 20w14∞ (April fools 2020), some dimensions feature colored lighting, so it's most likely possible, and colored lighting could create some great atmosphere! ~

Whenever we want to make colored light we put stained glass in front of glowstone but it has a yellowish orange tint with this it won't.

They should make it so that the glow squids drop a new drop that can be combined with colored glass to make glow glass so it will give off a glow (the same amount as glowstone) of whatever color the glass was.
when i saw this suggestion I thought it was walls a Planck length wide.
That would be a very long wall, indeed...
In java ancient debris can´t be destroyed by lava. I don´t know what happend in bedrock.
Yeah, in Java edition it doesn't. I don't know if you mean Bedrock edition.
